result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Kenisha L Deramus

10:21 AM Defendant Kenisha L Deramus in court.  Attorney Jacob Nelson Garman in court for State of Wisconsin. Court Reporter Donna Moore. 
Matter scheduled as a plea and sentencing hearing. 
Defendant indicates she has not gone to the SPD office and would like to see if she qualifies for services. 
State puts the offer on the record. 
BTC: Matter set over.
Status conference scheduled for January 20, 2023 at 08:30 am.

Racine County Alternatives Program - Progress Report.

8:53 AM Defendant Kenisha L Deramus in court.  Prosecuting attorney Jennifer Flynn in court for the State of Wisconsin. Court Reporter Donna Moore. 
Matter scheduled as a status conference. 
Defendant provides proof of RCAP results. Defendant plans to accept the offer. 
State puts offer on the record. 
BTC: Matter set over for COP.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for October 25, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Plea/sentencing hearing on October 25, 2022 at 10:00 am.
State's NOI to Intro Deft's Statements
DA AUTHORIZATION TO OBTAIN COPIES OF CERTAIN EVIDENCE

Charges per attached criminal complaint. Conditions: Make all court appearances on time. Failure to appear will result in the issuance of a warrant for your arrest, possible bail jumping charges and forfeiture of any bond on deposit. It is a condition of this bond that the defendant NOT consume or possess any controlled substances. This is to be monitored through random drug screens and/or breathalyzers by the Racine County Alternatives Program, Room MC340 (Law Enforcement Center 717 Wisconsin Ave Racine WI 53403). New referrals from Court must report on the day of their Court appearance.  Jail releases must report the following business day (M-Fr 8am-4:30pm).  In addition to random testing, the defendant is further ordered to test after each court appearance.

2:29 PM Prosecuting attorney Brooke L Erickson in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Kenisha L Deramus in court. Court Reporter Mark Garvin. 
BTC: Vacate Warrant, Reading of complaint is waived, probable cause found, p-ng, bond set.
Status conference scheduled for September 6, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Status conference on September 6, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Warrant forwarded to JP for entry.
